humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the tumor is a poorly differentiated invasive ductal carcinoma with a tumor diameter of 1.8 cm and a classification of NOS, G III, pT1Nla(sn)LOVORO. The 'pT1' indicates that the tumor size is between 0.2 cm and 2 cm, and the 'Nla(sn)' suggests that there is a metastasis in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes (N1) and that the sentinel lymph node was positive for metastatic carcinoma (sn). Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The 'pT1Nla(sn)LOVORO' portion of the diagnosis indicates the pathologic tumor stage (pT) as T1 (tumor size up to 2 cm), N stage as N1 (cancer has spread to 1-3 axillary lymph nodes), and there is no distant metastasis (M0 is implied). The 'a' indicates that axillary lymph node dissection has not been performed, and the '(sn)' indicates that sentinel lymph node biopsy has been performed. 'LOVORO' does not contribute to the TNM staging. Therefore, the N stage from this report is N1.
